senses.de: to give up something such as power, responsibility or a claim
senses.ex: He will relinquish his role as CEO at the end of the year.

Tips.title: Not Just Objects
Tips.description: Relinquish isn't only about physical items; it can refer to abstract things like roles or claims.
Tips.example: She reluctantly relinquished her claim to the estate.

Tips.title: Voluntary Action
Tips.description: Relinquishing often involves a conscious decision to surrender something voluntarily.
Tips.example: He chose to relinquish his parental rights.

Tips.title: Formal Context
Tips.description: The word 'relinquish' is formal and used in official or serious situations.
Tips.example: The general was forced to relinquish command of the army.

senses.ex: After his defeat, he relinquished the championship title.

Tips.title: Physical Letting Go
Tips.description: The action of relinquishing can be the physical act of letting something go from your grasp.
Tips.example: She reluctantly relinquished her hold on the old family album.

Tips.title: Figurative Release
Tips.description: It can also be used figuratively to describe giving up a position or title.
Tips.example: He relinquished his title as the fastest runner in school.

Tips.title: Not Immediate
Tips.description: Relinquishing something doesn't always happen instantly; it can be a process.
Tips.example: Over the next few months, he will relinquish his responsibilities to his successor.

senses.ex: He relinquished his grip on the steering wheel.

Tips.title: Let Go
Tips.description: When utilized physically, it suggests completely releasing one's grip or hold on something.
Tips.example: The child wouldn't relinquish his hold on the toy.

Tips.title: Emotional Release
Tips.description: It can refer to letting go of emotions, grudges, or stress, not just physical items.
Tips.example: After years of resentment, he finally relinquished his anger.

Tips.title: Loss of Control
Tips.description: Relinquishing control means you no longer dictate or influence the situation.
Tips.example: When the CEO fell ill, she had to relinquish control of the company.

Abandon.wordDefinition:
Abandon means to completely give up on something or someone with no intention of returning or supporting them in the future.

It is usually a negative term and indicates a sense of desertion or neglect. For example, a person might abandon a project, a relationship, or a child.

Abandon is used when there is a sense of betrayal, rejection or disregard, while relinquish is used when there is a sense of sacrifice, generosity or compliance.

Cede.wordDefinition:
Both cede and relinquish mean to give up something or to surrender something, but there is a slight difference between the two.

Cede is usually used in reference to official or legal situations. It is the act of transferring ownership or control of something, usually territory or rights, from one person or group to another.

For example, a city might cede a piece of land to a neighboring town or a country might cede control of a disputed area to another country.

Cede is used more in official or legal contexts, while relinquish is used in a wider range of situations where someone is giving up something voluntarily.

Give up.wordDefinition:
Both give up and relinquish mean to let go of something, but there's a slight difference in their usage.

Give up implies that you are surrendering or abandoning something that belonged to you, either because you no longer want it or because you have been forced to give it up.

For example, you might give up a habit, a possession, or your claim to something.

Relinquish is often used in legal or official contexts, to mean that you are voluntarily giving up something that you had rights over, such as property, a title, or a position.

Give up tends to be used more informally, while relinquish is more formal and often implies some sort of legal or official context.

Renounce.wordDefinition:
Renounce refers to the act of formally giving up or refusing something, usually with the intention of disowning or rejecting it.

In simpler terms, relinquish is giving up something willingly, while renounce is giving up something with the intention of rejecting it.

However, if someone wants to renounce their citizenship, they need to formally reject it and all that it entails.

Resign.wordDefinition:
Resign means to quit or give up a position or job, typically with an official announcement. An example sentence would be "The CEO decided to resign from his position at the company.".

Relinquish is used when giving up control or possession, while resign is used when quitting a job or position.

Surrender.wordDefinition:
The words relinquish and surrender both refer to giving up something, but they have different meanings and are used in different situations.

Surrender means to give up something because you have no other choice or you have been defeated.

This word is often used in a military context, when soldiers are forced to give up their weapons and surrender to the enemy.

For example, "After years of fighting, the army was forced to surrender to the enemy."

Relinquish is used when someone is willingly giving up something they have control over, while surrender is used when someone is forced to give up something they want to keep.

Waive.wordDefinition:
Waive means to give up a right or claim to something. For example, a person might waive their right to sue someone in court.

The main difference is that relinquish is used when you give up something you have, while waive is used when you give up a right or claim to something.

Yield.wordDefinition:
Both relinquish and yield mean to give up, but there are some slight differences in their usage.

Yield is a bit more general and can mean either consciously or unconsciously giving up something. For example, you might yield to another driver in traffic, or you might yield to temptation and eat a cookie even though you're trying to stick to a diet.

Overall, both words can be used when you need to cede control or give up something to someone or something else, but relinquish is more intentional and yield is more general.

quotes.Text: Our daughter was not damaged or hurt in any way. She was simply relinquished to foster care by two people who were not ready to be parents. I admire them for giving her the chance for a better life. And I am grateful they gave my husband and me the opportunity to be parents.
quotes.Title: Canadian Actress
quotes.Name: Nia Vardalos

quotes.Text: As prime minister, I would relinquish to citizens as much of my social, political, and economic control as possible, leaving people to cultivate their own personal prosperity and to govern their own affairs as directly as possible.
quotes.Title: Canadian Politician
quotes.Name: Pierre Poilievre

quotes.Text: A constructive approach to diplomacy doesn't mean relinquishing one's rights. It means engaging with one's counterparts, on the basis of equal footing and mutual respect, to address shared concerns and achieve shared objectives.
quotes.Title: Iranian Leader
quotes.Name: Hassan Rouhani

quotes.Text: It's important to remember that a dictator will not freely relinquish power after having hijacked the constitution and ruled with threats and promises. Sometimes it is necessary to put enough pressure on him that he leaves.
quotes.Title: Venezuelan Politician
quotes.Name: Juan Guaido

quotes.Text: The natural state of motherhood is unselfishness. When you become a mother, you are no longer the center of your own universe. You relinquish that position to your children.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Jessica Lange

quotes.Text: Women have always ruled my life, be it my mother, my wife, my assistant, or my daughter, so I don't really fight with them. I relinquished control years ago.
quotes.Title: American Singer
quotes.Name: Jon Bon Jovi

quotes.Text: Sometime early in life, I developed the notion - one which I have never relinquished - that writing a novel is the very finest thing a person can do.
quotes.Title: American Psychologist
quotes.Name: Irvin D. Yalom

quotes.Text: To protect our freedoms, it seems we're going to have to relinquish some of our freedoms for a short period of time.
quotes.Title: Canadian Singer
quotes.Name: Neil Young

quotes.Text: Dear is your heart and close your hand, I relinquish all to love's dysmorphic command.
quotes.Title: American Artist
quotes.Name: Isabel Yosito

quotes.Text: We must never relinquish the vision of a humane society and a humane world.
quotes.Title: Norwegian Statesman
quotes.Name: Kjell Magne Bondevik
